titles.title: Recognizing and honoring the Young Men's Christian Association on the occasion of its 150th anniversary in the United States.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.
Mr. Osborne moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Con. Res. 172.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary.

bill.summary: 6/26/2001--Passed House amended. Honors the Young Men's Christian Association (YMCA) for 150 years of building strong youth, strong families, and strong communities in the United States. Expresses support for the continued good work of the YMCA during the next 150 years.
